meanings.definition: To hoist or haul (a ship) by means of a parbuckle.
meanings.sent1: The sailors parbuckled the heavy cargo onto the ship.
meanings.sent2: They parbuckled the crates onto the deck with ease.
meanings.sent3: The crew parbuckled the treasure chest onto the ship, hoping it wouldn't fall overboard.
meanings.sent4: She parbuckled her dreams to new heights, never giving up.
meanings.sent5: The image of the sailors parbuckling the ship into the stormy sea was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: To lift or move (something heavy) using a parbuckle.
meanings.sent1: We parbuckled the fallen tree off the road to clear the way.
meanings.sent2: The workers parbuckled the boulder out of the way with teamwork.
meanings.sent3: The children tried to parbuckle the giant rock, pretending to be superheroes.
meanings.sent4: He parbuckled his burdens away, feeling lighter with each effort.
meanings.sent5: The sight of them parbuckling the massive statue was truly impressive.

meanings.definition: The act of using a parbuckle to lift or move something.
meanings.sent1: The parbuckled cargo swung gently in the air before being lowered onto the dock.
meanings.sent2: The successful parbuckle of the piano amazed the audience.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy parbuckle of the grand piano caused laughter among the spectators.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a strong parbuckle, lifting her through challenges.
meanings.sent5: The ancient technique of parbuckling fascinated the history enthusiasts.
